page.title: 03UPMINSTER STATION
page.content: Upminster station was established in {1885}on the Fenchurch Street to Southend Line.In{1921}it became the last station on the{London Transport {District Line.}The railway was the subsequent cause of the rapid development of Upminster.Much of the population of Upminster commute to London using the regular main line and tube services.The 4500 people using the station do so mainly in the{rush {hour}between 7:30 and 9:30 in the morning into London and 5:00 and 7:00 in the evening returning. Employment is provided for some 14 people.The station has recently had much needed repairs and repainting.The station also handles pupils travelling to school from the eastern side of London.Many people travel to Romford to do their shopping on the{Push and {Pull Line.
